service:
You can use the Billing API to programatically list the billing views available to you for a given time period. A billing view represents a set of billing data.

The Billing API provides the following endpoint:

https://billing.us-east-1.api.aws

operations.CreateBillingView: Creates a billing view with the specified billing view attributes.
operations.GetBillingView: Returns the metadata associated to the specified billing view ARN.
operations.GetResourcePolicy: Returns the resource-based policy document attached to the resource in JSON format.
operations.ListBillingViews:
Lists the billing views available for a given time period.

Every Amazon Web Services account has a unique PRIMARY billing view that represents the billing data available by default. Accounts that use Billing Conductor also have BILLING_GROUP billing views representing pro forma costs associated with each created billing group.
operations.ListSourceViewsForBillingView: Lists the source views (managed Amazon Web Services billing views) associated with the billing view.
operations.ListTagsForResource: Lists tags associated with the billing view resource.
operations.TagResource: An API operation for adding one or more tags (key-value pairs) to a resource.
operations.UntagResource: Removes one or more tags from a resource. Specify only tag keys in your request. Don't specify the value.
operations.UpdateBillingView: An API to update the attributes of the billing view.

AccessDeniedException.base: You don't have sufficient access to perform this action.

refs.BillingViewElement$ownerAccountId: The account owner of the billing view.
refs.BillingViewListElement$ownerAccountId: The list of owners of the Billing view.
refs.ListBillingViewsRequest$ownerAccountId: The list of owners of the billing view.

ActiveTimeRange.base: A time range with a start and end time.

refs.ListBillingViewsRequest$activeTimeRange: The time range for the billing views listed. PRIMARY billing view is always listed. BILLING_GROUP billing views are listed for time ranges when the associated billing group resource in Billing Conductor is active. The time range must be within one calendar month.

refs.BillingViewElement$arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that can be used to uniquely identify the billing view.
refs.BillingViewListElement$arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that can be used to uniquely identify the billing view.
refs.CreateBillingViewResponse$arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that can be used to uniquely identify the billing view.
refs.DeleteBillingViewRequest$arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that can be used to uniquely identify the billing view.
refs.DeleteBillingViewResponse$arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that can be used to uniquely identify the billing view.
refs.GetBillingViewRequest$arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that can be used to uniquely identify the billing view.
refs.ListSourceViewsForBillingViewRequest$arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that can be used to uniquely identify the billing view.
refs.UpdateBillingViewRequest$arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that can be used to uniquely identify the billing view.
refs.UpdateBillingViewResponse$arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that can be used to uniquely identify the billing view.

refs.ListBillingViewsRequest$arns: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that can be used to uniquely identify the billing view.

refs.BillingViewElement$description: The description of the billing view.
refs.BillingViewListElement$description: The description of the billing view.
refs.CreateBillingViewRequest$description: The description of the billing view.
refs.UpdateBillingViewRequest$description: The description of the billing view.

BillingViewElement.base: The metadata associated to the billing view.

refs.GetBillingViewResponse$billingView: The billing view element associated with the specified ARN.

refs.BillingViewElement$name: The account name of the billing view.
refs.BillingViewListElement$name: A list of names of the Billing view.
refs.CreateBillingViewRequest$name: The name of the billing view.
refs.UpdateBillingViewRequest$name: The name of the billing view.

refs.CreateBillingViewRequest$sourceViews: A list of billing views used as the data source for the custom billing view.
refs.ListSourceViewsForBillingViewResponse$so: A list of billing views used as the data source for the custom billing view.

refs.ListBillingViewsRequest$maxResults: The maximum number of billing views to retrieve. Default is 100.
refs.ListSourceViewsForBillingViewRequest$max: The number of entries a paginated response contains.

refs.CreateBillingViewRequest$clientToken: A unique, case-sensitive identifier you specify to ensure idempotency of the request. Idempotency ensures that an API request completes no more than one time. If the original request completes successfully, any subsequent retries complete successfully without performing any further actions with an idempotent request.

ConflictException.base: The requested operation would cause a conflict with the current state of a service resource associated with the request. Resolve the conflict before retrying this request.

refs.DimensionValues$key: The names of the metadata types that you can use to filter and group your results.

DimensionValues.base: The metadata that you can use to filter and group your results.

refs.ValidationExceptionField$message: The message describing why the field failed validation.

Expression.base: See Expression. Billing view only supports LINKED_ACCOUNT and Tags.

refs.BillingViewElement$dataFilterExpression: See Expression. Billing view only supports LINKED_ACCOUNT and Tags.
refs.CreateBillingViewRequest$dataFilterExpre: See Expression. Billing view only supports LINKED_ACCOUNT and Tags.

InternalServerException.base: The request processing failed because of an unknown error, exception, or failure.

refs.ListBillingViewsRequest$nextToken: The pagination token that is used on subsequent calls to list billing views.
refs.ListBillingViewsResponse$nextToken: The pagination token to use on subsequent calls to list billing views.
refs.ListSourceViewsForBillingViewRequest$nex: The pagination token that is used on subsequent calls to list billing views.
refs.ListSourceViewsForBillingViewResponse$ne: The pagination token that is used on subsequent calls to list billing views.

refs.GetResourcePolicyResponse$policy: The resource-based policy document attached to the resource in JSON format.

refs.GetResourcePolicyRequest$resourceArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the billing view resource to which the policy is attached to.
refs.GetResourcePolicyResponse$resourceArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the billing view resource to which the policy is attached to.
refs.ListTagsForResourceRequest$resourceArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.
refs.TagResourceRequest$resourceArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.
refs.UntagResourceRequest$resourceArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

refs.ConflictException$resourceId: The identifier for the service resource associated with the request.
refs.ResourceNotFoundException$resourceId: Value is a list of resource IDs that were not found.

ResourceNotFoundException.base: The specified ARN in the request doesn't exist.

ResourceTag.base: The tag structure that contains a tag key and value.

refs.ResourceTag$key: The key that's associated with the tag.

refs.UntagResourceRequest$resourceTagKeys: A list of tag key value pairs that are associated with the resource.

refs.CreateBillingViewRequest$resourceTags: A list of key value map specifying tags associated to the billing view being created.
refs.ListTagsForResourceResponse$resourceTags: A list of tag key value pairs that are associated with the resource.
refs.TagResourceRequest$resourceTags: A list of tag key value pairs that are associated with the resource.

refs.ResourceTag$value: The value that's associated with the tag.

refs.ConflictException$resourceType: The type of resource associated with the request.
refs.ResourceNotFoundException$resourceType: Value is the type of resource that was not found.
refs.ServiceQuotaExceededException$resourceTy: The type of Amazon Web Services resource.

ServiceQuotaExceededException.base: You've reached the limit of resources you can create, or exceeded the size of an individual resource.

TagValues.base: The values that are available for a tag.

ThrottlingException.base: The request was denied due to request throttling.

refs.ActiveTimeRange$activeBeforeInclusive: The inclusive time range end date.
refs.BillingViewElement$createdAt: The time when the billing view was created.
refs.BillingViewElement$updatedAt: The time when the billing view was last updated.
refs.CreateBillingViewResponse$createdAt: The time when the billing view was created.
refs.UpdateBillingViewResponse$updatedAt: The time when the billing view was last updated.

ValidationException.base: The input fails to satisfy the constraints specified by an Amazon Web Services service.

ValidationExceptionField.base: The field's information of a request that resulted in an exception.

refs.ValidationException$fieldList: The input fails to satisfy the constraints specified by an Amazon Web Services service.

refs.ValidationException$reason: The input fails to satisfy the constraints specified by an Amazon Web Services service.

refs.DimensionValues$values: The metadata values that you can use to filter and group your results.
refs.TagValues$values: The specific value of the tag.
